adrFormatAddress: 441 E 9th St, New York, NY 10009-4958, USA

originalText.text:
Completely delicious, a 5-star establishment. Only showing low rating for lack of accessibility and accessibility transparency. Like many places in the east village, this place is inaccessible. However, at least as of September 2023, it reads accessible on Google Maps, which it‚Äôs not. Fortunately the shop is small enough that you can be see and be seen and probably get what you want if you want it. But not accessible and could be easily with a short ramp.

If you‚Äôre not accessible, you get one star. That‚Äôs how I roll ü§∑‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è

IMAGE DESCRIPTION: the facade of the shop. There‚Äôs a step to get in, and the door is closed.

originalText.text: I‚Äôve been hunting for great gluten free places around NYC- this is the cutest little shop! The banana bread was moist and delicious and tasted just like regular banana bread. Great warm drinks too!

text.text: I‚Äôve been hunting for great gluten free places around NYC- this is the cutest little shop! The banana bread was moist and delicious and tasted just like regular banana bread. Great warm drinks too!

originalText.text:
I was going to give 3 but I took one off cuz of the service. Every time I come here (which isn‚Äôt often) the staff is rude and passive aggressive. If I ask questions they act annoyed. I thought it was just me, but seein how the owner responds passive aggressively and snarky to negative reviews, shows me enough. Happened the first time, happened the second. Childish and rude. You don‚Äôt know what someone is going through. It‚Äôs hard times, we just want dessert.

The food, I got the lemon square before, I won‚Äôt lie. Phenomenal. Delicious, sweet and tart.

Edit: I also got the croissants. I thought maybe it was because there‚Äôs no yeast, it wouldn‚Äôt be flaky. I was correct. I had them day one at room temp, as suggested: they were very dry, and dense. Lacked flavor. A little too sweet in my opinion, expecting a warm, salty and butter flavor. They reminded me more of those pilsbury ‚Äúcrescents‚Äù. I had them the next day warmed up, much better. They pull apart very nicely when warm. Soft, like a croissant should be, a hint of butter but I think it needs more, there‚Äôs a flavor missing. Good with some jam. They‚Äôre good as a snack, but they‚Äôre very small. $5 a croissant, you get 4 small ones. Given the ingredients, it makes sense for the price, just wish they were bigger. I‚Äôd give them a 3/5. They‚Äôre pretty.

Overall, I don‚Äôt feel too comfortable in returning because of the customer service, I have not had a warm experience personally twice and I enjoy when I come somewhere and I feel welcome.

originalText.text: Not only does this small shop have a wide variety of tasty treats, but also a few vegan options as well!  As someone who is not only stuck with a gluten intolerance, I am also a vegetarian. and it‚Äôs not easy to find a spot for yummalicious chocolate treats that have ANY vegetarian options, nevermind also gluten free ones ! RUN, don‚Äôt walk and grab yourself a delicious treat, You will not be disappointed! üòã

originalText.text: Elisa‚Äôs prepared a vegan, gluten free and sugar free wedding cake for our wedding reception which was last night. The cake, with a mango filling and cashew cream frosting, and sweetened with monk fruit, turned out delicious and it also looked beautiful, and everyone enjoyed it. It was the only bakery in the area we could find that would accommodate all our dietary requirements!
